metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31742 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker could have exploited a timing attack by sending a large number of allowCredential entries and detecting the difference between invalid key handles and cross-origin key handles. This could have led to cross-origin account linking in violation of WebAuthn goals. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.10, Firefox < 101, and Firefox ESR < 91.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
